rComments: He's an all over the place kind of guy but he makes class interesting and knows exactly what he's talking about. He also really cares of your knowledge of the material. worth taking his class.

He is one of the most eccentric teachers I have ever had. He does get flustered quite easily. He has timelines of when you should be finished with projects, but does not relay them to the class very well. You do have to come into work on your pieces outside of class if you aren't fast. He tells funny stories and is very laid back. Would take again

Expects you to listen in class and do the homework- if you're a non major in his ceramics class, you're expected to spend time in the studio outside class or you WILL suffer. Scattered and can lose his patience very easily, but if you make an effort he'll like you.

He was my favorite art teacher at UCSC. He challenged me into the best work I have ever done. I was definately afraid to bring in half assed work because he demanded the best from you for every project.  He offered great critique advice and was always willing to help one on one. I felt that our class had some of thebest work up at open studios.

Although Don's critiques are often quite harsh, they are ultimately good for you. He is very knowledgable about Art theory and history, and will give you tons of one-on-one technical help if you want it. He often brings in slides and books on artists which are increadibly helpful and inspiring. You will learn a LOT, but lazy students beware.
I really enjoyed taking his class.  I got more out of it than I expected.  It challenged me (not an easy class) but I learned so much about drawing approaches and techniques.

He is one of the best prof. I have ever had.  He encourages students to challenge themselves and learn a range of mixed media techniques.  Knowing a lot about art theory and contemporary art he makes the class engaging and current.  I find that his associative approach to thinking and explaining ideas and concepts complements the linear textbook.

Not a nice man, very egotistic. Expects students to have a firm grasps on some ideologies like cliche and color theory (un realistic) and brings his personal life into the class room. Very unhelpful and sometimes just down right rude. No constuctive critisizm here

He cant decide if he loves your work or hates it.He is hard on some and completley easy on others.Refuses to explain anything and tells you to look at the book.There is so much work that you never finish one piece to your satisfaction. Spends way too much time on critiques and not enough on drawing.

Oh my!  When first you meet this teacher, he seems incredibly intimdating...don't let THAT scare you, thats just the wacky ego talking... let the fact that he picks on some students more than others and switch from rude to supportive during a critique and or portfolio review...RUN.
